thread.title: Jews open temple to Muslims after mosque burns down
thread.title_full: Jews open temple to Muslims after mosque burns down

author: Humankind
title: Jews open temple to Muslims after mosque burns down

organizations.name: bbc news 1:45 trump administration putting 'iran on notice' associated press

text:
Jews open temple to Muslims after mosque burns down USA TODAY 5 hrs ago Humankind Click to expand Replay Video This Congresswoman is Helping Lead the Progressive Resistance Washington Rep. Pramila Jayapal explains her approach to taking on the Trump administration. NowThis News What does it mean for the White House to put Iran 'on notice' MSNBC's Brian Williams speaks with NBC New's Andrea Mitchell about the White House putting Iran 'on notice,' plus the days other headlines about Trump's rocky phone calls with world leaders. MSNBC Reporter: Trump bragged to Australian PM Washington Post reporter Philip Rucker tells CNN's Anderson Cooper that President Trump bragged about his electoral college victory while on a phone call with the Australian Prime minister, Malcolm Turnbull. CNN SETTINGS OFF HD HQ SD LO Jews open temple to Muslims after mosque burns down USA TODAY See more videos SHARE SHARE TWEET SHARE EMAIL What to watch next This Congresswoman is Helping Lead the Progressive Resistance NowThis News 1:25 What does it mean for the White House to put Iran 'on notice' MSNBC 7:35 Reporter: Trump bragged to Australian PM CNN 1:59 Why does Trump Scotch tape his tie? CNN 2:05 Breitbart News editor event canceled after violent protests CBS News 2:15 Hostage situation at Delaware prison CBS News 1:10 Trump rips media at Black History Month event CNN 2:39 Lava Pours Steadily From Hawaii's Kilauea Volcano The Wall Street Journal. 1:03 This Is What Registration Day For Muslims Would Look Like NowThis News 1:13 NAFTA negotiation will start in May, according to Mexico AFP 0:45 Trump Says Republicans Should 'Go Nuclear' To Make Sure His SCOTUS Nominee Is Confirmed NowThis News 1:45 First Lady: I'll do it my way CNN 2:50 Life in Ukraine fighting escalates BBC News 1:45 Trump Administration Putting 'Iran on Notice' Associated Press 1:40 Trump backs 'nuclear option' in Supreme Court fight AFP 0:56 Tillerson pledges to ‘represent the interest of all of the American people’ The Washington Post 2:21 UP NEXT VICTORIA, Texas — Early Saturday morning, members of the Victoria Islamic Center were notified that that their mosque had been destroyed by a fire overnight.
The incident occurred just hours after President Donald Trump signed his controversial executive order blocking citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries from entering the United States. At this time, the cause of the fire is unknown and being investigated.
The small town of 62,000 immediately came together, with leaders of different faiths sharing their support.
Members of the one Jewish temple in the town, the Congregation B’Nai Israel, were the first to offer their house of worship. They handed their synagogue’s keys to one of the mosque's founders.
“We were very happy to do this,” Melvin Lack, treasurer of Congregation B’Nai Israel tells USA TODAY. “You feel what’s happening in the community and everyone reacts.”
Soon, a GoFundMe page was created to raise money for reconstruction. Within only a few days, over $1 million had been donated, far surpassing the initial goal of $850,000.
“Our hearts are filled with gratitude for the tremendous support we've received,” writes the page’s organizer, Omar Rachid. “The outpouring of love, kind words, hugs, helping hands and the financial contributions are examples of the true American Spirit and Humanity at its best.”
Signs rest outside the Victoria Islamic Center a day after a fire destroyed the mosque in Victoria, Texas January 29, 2017. REUTERS/Mohammad Khursheed This is not the first time that different faith-based organizations have supported each other in time of need in Victoria.
In 2008, the Temple B’Nai Israel was vandalized when assailants painted swastikas and other anti-Semitic slurs on the building. The perpetrators were caught and the temple was cleaned. “Throughout that time period,” Lack says. “churches and the Muslim community, everyone poured out their hearts to us and said this is horrible.”
Days after last weekend’s fire, the community continues to offer their support. On Tuesday, pictures emerged of young members of the community holding signs of love and support.
